question.question-text: It is stated in the passage that the mass of an average brown dwarf

answer-list.answer-text: is smaller than the mass of the Sun
generates an extremely high internal temperature
is capable of igniting nuclear burning
causes the release of considerable energy and light

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, a brown dwarf cools off

answer-list.answer-text: within the first million years of its existence
after its contraction is complete
at the same time that it contracts
in order to begin contracting

question.question-text: What is stated in paragraph 2 about a brown dwarf that has cooled off for several million years?

answer-list.answer-text: Its weak light makes it difficult to see from Earth.
It no longer emits light.
Its weak light has begun the process of restrengthening.
Scientists are unable to study it.

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 3 that

answer-list.answer-text: the amount of hydrogen in a brown dwarf has increased dramatically
a brown dwarf had far more hydrogen when it first formed
three-quarters of the core of a brown dwarf is hydrogen
the internal composition of a brown dwarf is always changing

question.question-text: According to paragraph 3, a white dwarf

answer-list.answer-text: It was easier to blend cocoa powder with sugar than it was to blend cocoa butter with sugar.
still burns a considerable amount of hydrogen
creates hydrogen from helium
no longer has a predominantly hydrogen core

question.question-text: What is mentioned in paragraph 4 about brown dwarfs?

answer-list.answer-text: They are quite different from large planets.
They are formed in the same way as large planets.
They can share some similarities with large planets.
They have nothing in common with large planets.

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 4 that Jupiter

answer-list.answer-text: radiates far less energy than a brown dwarf
is a brown dwarf
formed in the same way as a brown dwarf
is in at least one respect similar to a brown dwarf
